thread.title: Cameron kills Saudi prison deal after Cabinet row
thread.title_full: Cameron kills Saudi prison deal after Cabinet row

title: Cameron kills Saudi prison deal after Cabinet row
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Cameron kills Saudi prison deal after Cabinet row Michael Gove had demanded that a £5.9 million deal with Saudi Arabia be scrapped Richard Pohle/The Times 1 of 1 Michael Gove had demanded that a £5.9 million deal with Saudi Arabia be scrapped Richard Pohle/The Times Callum Jones , Political Reporter, and Rachel Sylvester Last updated at 1:20PM, October 13 2015 
The British government has bowed to intense pressure and pulled out of a controversial prison services deal with Saudi Arabia amid concerns over human rights. 
Downing Street revealed today that the UK had rescinded a bid to provide “training-needs analysis” for the state’s penal system, following a row over the issue in the highest ranks of government. Saudi officials have been informed of the decision. 
It comes after The Times this morning revealed that Michael Gove, the lord chancellor and justice secretary, was accused of naivety by Philip Hammond, the foreign secretary, over his demand that the £5.9 million deal Subscribe now 
To see the full article you need to subscribe Subscribe
